Well, it is true that I don't think of this list is as made of a few some
"=
enlightened" who made their life purpose to teach us, the mere ignorants,
t=
he mysteries of something that only those highnesses possess. I do think
th=
is is a list of peers, professionals of the same area, and as far as I'm
co=
ncerned all at the same level of professional worthtiness. I said once and
=
I repeat, since you want this discussion  to go to this level: who the hell=

died and made you high priest? Why the frack do you think you're more
dese=
rving of respect than the others, and that you're word should not be
disput=
ed?

Is it because you're been trying to understand REST for the last 12 ye=
ars
and you didn't suceeded yet? If I had to spend 12 years for every techn=
ology
I worked in my life I will be 200 years old by now.
C'mon, in my book=
 someone who spend 12 years trying  to learn something and
all he has is qu=
estionable opinions, I would call that person, well,
limited, to refrain my=
self from harsh words...

Get real, the time you spend learning means sqwac=
k, zero, rien, nada... Its
what you have learned, not the time. All I known=
 of OSGi, for example, I
learned from a guy half my age and maybe 1/10 of p=
rofessional years... and
he did knew about that, and I did learn with him.
=

C'mon guys REST is just a technology, stop acting like its the most
import=
ant thing on earth since sliced bread...

That being said, I think its good=
 for me if you stop answering(!) my posts.
Less time I waste reading your q=
uestionable opinions, to be kind in words.
Of course, this is the third tim=
e you've been trying to piss me since you
said that, so we'll never know. B=
ut please do it. You know what? GFY...

Its "good for you" just in case...
=

action of the time it's

t REST.  You, who
couldn't possibly know REST because you're just starting =
with it by
your own admission, are absolutely certain that you know better =
than
those who have, to the point where you are comfortable finding fault
w=
ith every expert in the field for not seeing REST as you do.

I spent many,=
 many years _listening_ and _asking_ before I ever
presumed to start _teach=
ing_.  You're like an incoming freshman who
thinks he knows better than his=
 professors -- obnoxious as hell.

-Eric

<p>Well, it is true that I don't think of this list is as made of a few=
 some "enlightened" who made their life purpose to teach us, the =
mere ignorants, the mysteries of something that only those highnesses posse=
ss. I do think this is a list of peers, professionals of the same area, and=
 as far as I'm concerned all at the same level of professional worthtin=
ess. I said once and I repeat, since you want this discussion=A0 to go to t=
his level: who the hell died and made you high priest? Why the frack do you=
 think you're more deserving of respect than the others, and that you&#=
39;re word should not be disputed?</p>

<p>Is it because you're been tr=
ying to understand REST for the last 12 years=A0 and you didn't suceede=
d yet? If I had to spend 12 years for every technology I worked in my life =
I will be 200 years old by now. <br>
C'mon, in my book someone who spen=
d 12 years trying=A0 to learn something and all he has is questionable opin=
ions, I would call that person, well, limited, to refrain myself from harsh=

<p>Get real, the time you spend learning means sqwack, zero, =
rien, nada... Its what you have learned, not the time. All I known of OSGi,=
 for example, I learned from a guy half my age and maybe 1/10 of profession=
al years... and he did knew about that, and I did learn with him.</p>

<p>C=
'mon guys REST is just a technology, stop acting like its the most impo=
rtant thing on earth since sliced bread...</p>
<p>That being said, I think =
its good for me if you stop answering(!) my posts. Less time I waste readin=

hird time you've been trying to piss me since you said that, so we'=
ll never know. But please do it. You know what? GFY...</p>

<p>Its "go=
od for you" just in case...</p>
